intro: Lathyrus polymorphus, commonly known as the variable vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. Lathyrus polymorphus is also noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a useful plant in agricultural settings.
